text:
<@UFHGN6TJ8> I didn’t know that existed! Very cool,

My idea is basically to recreate <https://github.com/dfm/exoplanet> with a few libraries, I think the application is really well suited for little functional blocks for changing how limb darkening is applied, apply other effects, etc. and of course Julia exceeds at composing little functional blocks.

To do this I was inevitably going to use Rodrigo’s limb darkening, it’s nice to know there’s a package in Julia with it, at first glance the interface isn’t quite how I would make it, but I also don’t know the implementation too well.

I am super open to anybody contributing, as I told Mosè my reason for starting to look into this is as a hook to entice people to try Julia for astro work, since transit community is huge and these high-level packages can tie into Julia’s PPL ecosystem very well, which would cover a lot of the missing ground between the two languages in terms of packages dfm and rodrigo, etc. have written

text: <@UDB26738Q>, we use an in-house code, but the long term goal is to port most of It's functionality over to <https://github.com/nespinoza/juliet|https://github.com/nespinoza/juliet> (written by the same person!) On our end, we use batman for the analytic transit model + george to model systematics and pymultinest for the fitting. There's a lot of similar functionality in all of these different transit codes in the exo community, so it is really cool to see things start expanding over to Julia!
